org.youscope.plugin.autofocus

Interface AutoFocusJob

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, EditableJobContainer, ImageProducer, Job, JobContainer, java.rmi.Remote, TableProducer

    public interface AutoFocusJob
extends Job, EditableJobContainer, ImageProducer, TableProducer
    Interface of a measurement job which automatically adjusts the focus.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gets the channel.
      java.lang.String getChannelGroup()
      Gets the channel group.
      double getExposure()
      Gets the exposure.
      int getFocusAdjustmentTime()
      Returns the focus adjustment time (the time the microscope is paused after the new focus position was set) in ms.
      java.lang.String getFocusDevice()
      Returns the focus device name for which the position should be changed.
      FocusScoreResource getFocusScoreAlgorithm()
      Returns the focus algorithm with which it is detected if the focus of an image made at a give focus position is better than the other.
      FocusSearchResource getFocusSearchAlgorithm()
      Returns the algorithm with which it is determined at which focus positions images are made to determine the best focal plane.
      boolean isRememberFocus()
      Returns true if next focus search should be centered around the last iterations maximal focal plane.

      Defines if the focus should be reset to its original value after the job (and all sub-jobs) finished.

      • setExposure

        void setExposure(double exposure)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, it sets the exposure of all cameras. Set to -1 if exposure should not be set.
        Parameters:
        exposure - The exposure.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getExposure

        double getExposure()
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, returns the exposure of the first camera.
        Returns:
        The exposure.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setResetFocusAfterSearch

        void setResetFocusAfterSearch(boolean resetFocusAfterSearch)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              MeasurementRunningException
        Defines if the focus should be reset to its original value after the job (and all sub-jobs) finished.
        Parameters:
        resetFocusAfterSearch - Set to true to return to original value.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setRememberFocus

        void setRememberFocus(boolean rememberFocus)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      MeasurementRunningException
        Set to true if next focus search should be centered around the last iterations maximal focal plane. If false, it always starts from focus before the job.
        Parameters:
        rememberFocus - True if next focus search should be centered around last maximum.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • isRememberFocus

        boolean isRememberFocus()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns true if next focus search should be centered around the last iterations maximal focal plane. If false, it always starts from focus before the job.
        Returns:
        True if next focus search is centered around last maximum.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isResetFocusAfterSearch

        boolean isResetFocusAfterSearch()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Defines if the focus should be reset to its original value after the job (and all sub-jobs) finished.
        Returns:
        true if returning to original value.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getFocusAdjustmentTime

        int getFocusAdjustmentTime()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the focus adjustment time (the time the microscope is paused after the new focus position was set) in ms.
        Returns:
        Focus adjustment time.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getFocusDevice

        java.lang.String getFocusDevice()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the focus device name for which the position should be changed.
        Returns:
        Focus device name, or null, if the currently active focus device should be changed.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setFocusDevice

        void setFocusDevice(java.lang.String focusDevice)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                    MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the focus device name for which the position should be changed. Initialized to be null.
        Parameters:
        focusDevice - Focus device name, or null, if the currently active focus device should be changed.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setFocusScoreAlgorithm

        void setFocusScoreAlgorithm(FocusScoreResource focusScoreAlgorithm)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                            MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the algorithm with which the score of an image is calculated (i.e. with which it is determined if an image made at a give focus position is better than an image made in another).
        Parameters:
        focusScoreAlgorithm -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setFocusSearchAlgorithm

        void setFocusSearchAlgorithm(FocusSearchResource focusSearchAlgorithm)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the algorithm with which it is determined at which focus positions images are made to determine the best focal plane. This decision in general depends on the scores of the images already made in different focal positions.
        Parameters:
        focusSearchAlgorithm -
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getFocusScoreAlgorithm

        FocusScoreResource getFocusScoreAlgorithm()
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the focus algorithm with which it is detected if the focus of an image made at a give focus position is better than the other.
        Returns:
        focus score algorithm configuration, or null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getFocusSearchAlgorithm

        FocusSearchResource getFocusSearchAlgorithm()
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the algorithm with which it is determined at which focus positions images are made to determine the best focal plane. This decision in general depends on the scores of the images already made in different focal positions.
        Returns:
        focus search algorithm configuration, or null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setImageDescription

        void setImageDescription(java.lang.String description)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         MeasurementRunningException
        Sets a short string describing the images which are made by this job.
        Parameters:
        description - The description which should be returned for the images produced by this job, or null, to switch to the default description.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException
